treatment.description: Herbs, perennial, rarely annual, perennials rhizomatous. Stems terete. Leaves basal and cauline; blade usually flat, involute, rarely nearly terete, channeled, not septate. Inflorescences terminal cymes, usually sympodial (monopodial in J. trifidus); bracts erect or ascending, flat, involute, or terete; bracteoles 2, at base of perianth. Flowers borne singly, not in heads. Capsules 1-locular (placentae 1/2--3/4 distance to central axis) or 3-locular, rarely beaked. Seeds not tailed (except J. vaseyi).
